snippet: Tobacco opponents today hailed the news that cigarette sales in California fell 30 percent in the first half of this year as higher state taxes and price increases pushed up their cost.     ''It's beyond our expectations,'' said the movie director...
lead_paragraph: Tobacco opponents today hailed the news that cigarette sales in California fell 30 percent in the first half of this year as higher state taxes and price increases pushed up their cost. ''It's beyond our expectations,'' said the movie director Rob Reiner, who led the push for a new 50-cent-per-pack state tax that was imposed in January to help pay for educational programs.
abstract: Tobacco opponents hail news that cigarette sales in California fell 30 percent in first half of 1999 as higher state taxes and price increases pushed up their cost (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Cigarette Sales Fall 30% As California Tax Rises
